segment.source: Identifying Computers for Inventory Collection (Windows 10)
segment.target: Identifying Computers for Inventory Collection (Windows 10)

segment.source: Identifying Computers for Inventory Collection
segment.target: Identifying Computers for Inventory Collection

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: An inventory-collector package gathers inventory data from the computers on which it is installed.
segment.target: An inventory-collector package gathers inventory data from the computers on which it is installed.

segment.source: This data includes the following:
segment.target: This data includes the following:

segment.source: System inventory.
segment.target: System inventory.

segment.source: Information about the client computer.
segment.target: Information about the client computer.

segment.source: This information includes the memory capacity, the processor speed, and the processor architecture.
segment.target: This information includes the memory capacity, the processor speed, and the processor architecture.

segment.source: Device inventory.
segment.target: Device inventory.

segment.source: Information about the devices that are installed on the client computer.
segment.target: Information about the devices that are installed on the client computer.

segment.source: This information includes the model, the manufacturer, and the device class.
segment.target: This information includes the model, the manufacturer, and the device class.

segment.source: Software inventory.
segment.target: Software inventory.

segment.source: An inventory of the applications that are installed on the computer.
segment.target: An inventory of the applications that are installed on the computer.

segment.source: This information includes system technologies such as Windows® Installer.
segment.target: This information includes system technologies such as Windows® Installer.

segment.source: To generate a complete inventory and obtain a comprehensive view of your organization, inventory all computers.
segment.target: To generate a complete inventory and obtain a comprehensive view of your organization, inventory all computers.

segment.source: However, remember that deploying inventory-collector packages to all computers in your organization will require the additional work of analyzing and reducing a larger list of applications.
segment.target: However, remember that deploying inventory-collector packages to all computers in your organization will require the additional work of analyzing and reducing a larger list of applications.

segment.source: If you do not have the resources to deploy to all computers or you cannot process a larger list of applications, consider deploying inventory-collector packages to representative subsets of computers instead.
segment.target: If you do not have the resources to deploy to all computers or you cannot process a larger list of applications, consider deploying inventory-collector packages to representative subsets of computers instead.

segment.source: If you decide to deploy inventory-collector packages to representative subsets of computers in your organization, consider the following:
segment.target: If you decide to deploy inventory-collector packages to representative subsets of computers in your organization, consider the following:

segment.source: Managed and Unmanaged Environments
segment.target: Managed and Unmanaged Environments

segment.source: Role-Based Applications
segment.target: Role-Based Applications

segment.source: Software Distribution
segment.target: Software Distribution

segment.source: Geographic Distribution
segment.target: Geographic Distribution

segment.source: Computer Types
segment.target: Computer Types

segment.source: Managed and Unmanaged Environments
segment.target: Managed and Unmanaged Environments

segment.source: In your organization, you may have managed environments and unmanaged environments.
segment.target: In your organization, you may have managed environments and unmanaged environments.

segment.source: In a managed environment, IT administrators strictly control and manage the installation and use of applications.
segment.target: In a managed environment, IT administrators strictly control and manage the installation and use of applications.

segment.source: In this environment, you can discover the full inventory by deploying inventory-collector packages to a limited subset of computers.
segment.target: In this environment, you can discover the full inventory by deploying inventory-collector packages to a limited subset of computers.

segment.source: In an unmanaged environment, users have administrator permissions and can install applications at their own discretion.
segment.target: In an unmanaged environment, users have administrator permissions and can install applications at their own discretion.

segment.source: To obtain the full inventory, you must deploy your inventory-collector packages to more computers.
segment.target: To obtain the full inventory, you must deploy your inventory-collector packages to more computers.

segment.source: Role-Based Applications
segment.target: Role-Based Applications

segment.source: Your organization may use role-based applications that relate to job function.
segment.target: Your organization may use role-based applications that relate to job function.

segment.source: For example, accountants may use finance-related applications.
segment.target: For example, accountants may use finance-related applications.

segment.source: Reviewing application use together with job function helps you better identify which subsets of computers need inventory-collector packages.
segment.target: Reviewing application use together with job function helps you better identify which subsets of computers need inventory-collector packages.

segment.source: Software Distribution
segment.target: Software Distribution

segment.source: You can distribute applications in various ways within an organization.
segment.target: You can distribute applications in various ways within an organization.

segment.source: For example, you can use Group Policy, Microsoft® IntelliMirror®, Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager, or a customized distribution method.
segment.target: For example, you can use Group Policy, Microsoft® IntelliMirror®, Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager, or a customized distribution method.

segment.source: Reviewing the policies for your software distribution system helps you better identify which subsets of computers need inventory-collector packages.
segment.target: Reviewing the policies for your software distribution system helps you better identify which subsets of computers need inventory-collector packages.

segment.source: Geographic Distribution
segment.target: Geographic Distribution

segment.source: While you plan for inventory collection, consider the geographic distribution of your organization, and consider application use within each region.
segment.target: While you plan for inventory collection, consider the geographic distribution of your organization, and consider application use within each region.

segment.source: Be sure to account for divisional applications, localized applications, and applications that are specific to the geographic location and export restrictions.
segment.target: Be sure to account for divisional applications, localized applications, and applications that are specific to the geographic location and export restrictions.

segment.source: Consult with technical and business leaders from each region to understand the differences and determine which subsets of computers need inventory-collector packages.
segment.target: Consult with technical and business leaders from each region to understand the differences and determine which subsets of computers need inventory-collector packages.

segment.source: Computer Types
segment.target: Computer Types

segment.source: Computer types can be an important factor in the deployment of inventory-collector packages.
segment.target: Computer types can be an important factor in the deployment of inventory-collector packages.

segment.source: The following sections describe common computer types.
segment.target: The following sections describe common computer types.

segment.source: Mobile Computers
segment.target: Mobile Computers

segment.source: Mobile users are frequently offline, occasionally synchronizing with the corporate network through a LAN or VPN connection.
segment.target: Mobile users are frequently offline, occasionally synchronizing with the corporate network through a LAN or VPN connection.

segment.source: The user must be online for the inventory-collector package to be downloaded and installed, and must be online again for the logged data to be uploaded.
segment.target: The user must be online for the inventory-collector package to be downloaded and installed, and must be online again for the logged data to be uploaded.

segment.source: Multiuser Computers
segment.target: Multiuser Computers

segment.source: Multiuser computers are typically in university computer labs, libraries, and organizations that enable job sharing.
segment.target: Multiuser computers are typically in university computer labs, libraries, and organizations that enable job sharing.

segment.source: These computers include a core set of applications that are always available, in addition to many applications that can be installed and removed as necessary.
segment.target: These computers include a core set of applications that are always available, in addition to many applications that can be installed and removed as necessary.

segment.source: Because these computers typically have a core set of applications, you can identify a narrow subset of computers to receive the inventory-collector package.
segment.target: Because these computers typically have a core set of applications, you can identify a narrow subset of computers to receive the inventory-collector package.

segment.source: AppStations and TaskStations
segment.target: AppStations and TaskStations

segment.source: AppStations that run vertical applications are typically for marketing, claims and loan processing, and customer service.
segment.target: AppStations that run vertical applications are typically for marketing, claims and loan processing, and customer service.

segment.source: TaskStations are typically dedicated to running a single application in a location such as a manufacturing floor (as an entry terminal) or a call center.
segment.target: TaskStations are typically dedicated to running a single application in a location such as a manufacturing floor (as an entry terminal) or a call center.

segment.source: Because AppStations and TaskStations do not typically enable users to add or remove applications, you can identify a narrow subset of computers to receive the inventory-collector package.
segment.target: Because AppStations and TaskStations do not typically enable users to add or remove applications, you can identify a narrow subset of computers to receive the inventory-collector package.

segment.source: Kiosks
segment.target: Kiosks

segment.source: Kiosks are generally in public areas.
segment.target: Kiosks are generally in public areas.

segment.source: These computers run unattended.
segment.target: These computers run unattended.

segment.source: They also generally run a single application by using a single-use account and automatic logon.
segment.target: They also generally run a single application by using a single-use account and automatic logon.

segment.source: Because these computers typically run a single application, you can identify a narrow subset of computers to receive the inventory-collector package.
segment.target: Because these computers typically run a single application, you can identify a narrow subset of computers to receive the inventory-collector package.
